title: Examen Semana 26: Saludos y Despedidas en Emails

questions.question: Which greeting is used when you don't know the recipient's name?
questions.explanation: 'Dear Sir/Madam' is the formal opening for an unknown recipient.

questions.question: If you start with 'Dear Sir/Madam', how should you close formally?
questions.explanation: Traditionally, 'Yours faithfully' matches 'Dear Sir/Madam'.

questions.question: What is the professional title for any woman, regardless of marital status?
questions.explanation: 'Ms.' is the standard, neutral professional title for women.

questions.question: Which closing is appropriate for a standard professional email to a client you know?
questions.explanation: 'Kind regards' is polite and professional for known clients.

questions.question: How do you address a man named James Brown formally?
questions.explanation: Formal address uses 'Dear Mr. [Last Name]'.

questions.question: Which of these is an INFORMAL greeting?
questions.explanation: 'Hi [First Name]' is used for informal communication.

questions.question: What is the common closing for an email to a close colleague?
questions.explanation: 'Best,' or 'Thanks,' is common for internal or informal emails.

questions.question: When do you use 'To whom it may concern'?
options: When you don't have a specific contact or department
questions.explanation: It is used for formal letters to an organization when no name is available.

questions.question: Which title is used for a married woman specifically?
questions.explanation: 'Mrs.' traditionally refers to a married woman.

questions.question: If you address someone as 'Dear Mr. Smith', what is a formal matching closing?
questions.explanation: 'Yours sincerely' is used when the recipient's name is known.

questions.question: What usually follows the greeting line (e.g., Dear John,)?
options: An opening sentence (e.g., I hope you are well)
questions.explanation: The opening sentence sets the tone after the greeting.

questions.question: Which of these is the most formal closing?
questions.explanation: 'Yours faithfully' is at the top of the formality scale.

questions.question: How do you address a group of people in an email?
questions.explanation: 'Hello Team' or 'Hi Everyone' is standard for groups.

questions.question: Which punctuation is used after the greeting in most business emails?
questions.explanation: A comma is the standard punctuation for email greetings.

questions.question: In an informal UK email, 'Cheers' means:
questions.explanation: In the UK, 'Cheers' is used as a casual way to say thanks or bye.

questions.question: What is 'Sincerely' in Spanish?
questions.explanation: 'Sincerely' is the formal equivalent of 'atentamente'.

questions.question: When should you use first names in business emails?
options: When the other person uses yours or you know them well
Only when you are the boss
questions.explanation: First name usage depends on the existing relationship and company culture.

questions.question: Which abbreviation is used for 'Doctor'?
questions.explanation: 'Dr.' is the standard abbreviation.

questions.question: Where do you place the 'Closing'?
questions.explanation: The closing comes after the body and before your name.

questions.question: Choose the correct spelling:
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is F-A-I-T-H-F-U-L-L-Y.
